intro: Hyssopus officinalis var. albus, commonly known as white hyssop, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces spikes of white or pale blue flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. White hyssop is often used in herbal medicine for its expectorant and antiseptic properties. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for garden cultivation.
